episodeTitle: Startling! The Big News Shakes Up the New World!
description: The world reacts to Doflamingo's shocking resignation from the Seven Warlords. The Straw Hats contact Doflamingo to arrange Caesar's exchange, while Law explains their plan to destroy the SMILE Factory. Buggy is revealed as a new Warlord, and Doflamingo unveils his possession of Ace's Devil Fruit, the Mera Mera no Mi.

events.title: Doflamingo's Resignation Revealed to the World
events.description: News breaks across the world that Donquixote Doflamingo has resigned from his position as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. This shocking announcement causes ripples throughout the New World, with various pirates and organizations reacting to the news.
events.significance: Doflamingo's resignation is a strategic move that sets up the entire Dressrosa Arc. It serves as bait for Luffy and Law, while creating chaos in the New World power structure.

events.title: Jewelry Bonney's Reaction to the Alliance
events.description: Jewelry Bonney is shown reading about Luffy and Law's alliance while eating pizza. She appears to be wearing a hoodie and seems to be alone, possibly after the Blackbeard attack wiped out her crew.
events.significance: Shows that the Worst Generation members are aware of and reacting to Luffy and Law's alliance, establishing the broader world's awareness of their plans.

events.title: Eustass Kid's Reaction and Analysis
events.description: At the Kid Pirates' base, the crew reads about Luffy and Law's alliance in the news. Kid correctly theorizes that Luffy and Law are going after one of the Four Emperors and wonders which one it is.
events.significance: Demonstrates Kid's intelligence and establishes him as a strategic thinker who understands the significance of alliances in the New World. Shows parallel ambitions between Kid and Luffy.

quotes.text: Luffy and Law teaming up... They must be going after one of the Four Emperors too.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid

events.title: Jinbe's Reaction to the News
events.description: Jinbe is shown reading about Doflamingo's resignation and the Luffy-Law alliance, expressing concern that these alliances will lead to trouble.
events.significance: Establishes Jinbe's continued awareness of Luffy's activities and his concern for his future captain's safety.

events.title: Crocodile's Cameo in the New World
events.description: A shadowy figure with Crocodile's trademark fur coat and golden hook is shown reading the news. The anime confirms this is Crocodile by showing his distinctive features, whereas the manga kept it more ambiguous.
events.significance: Confirms Crocodile's presence in the New World and his continued interest in major events. This is an anime-original confirmation that wasn't explicit in the manga.

events.title: Straw Hats Contact Doflamingo
events.description: The Straw Hat crew contacts Donquixote Doflamingo via Den Den Mushi to arrange an exchange of Caesar Clown. Luffy threatens Doflamingo, who retaliates by stating he possesses something Luffy wants badly.
events.significance: This conversation sets up the hostage exchange at Green Bit and Doflamingo's trap for the Straw Hats. It's a critical moment that drives the plot into Dressrosa.

quotes.text: I have something you want very badly, Straw Hat.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo taunting Luffy during their phone conversation

events.title: Law Explains the SMILE Factory Plan
events.description: During breakfast on the Thousand Sunny, Trafalgar Law explains his plan to destroy the SMILE Factory on Dressrosa while Doflamingo is distracted by the hostage exchange at Green Bit.
events.significance: Reveals Law's strategic thinking and the true objective of their mission to Dressrosa. This plan becomes the central conflict of the arc.

events.title: Buggy Revealed as a Warlord
events.description: At Marine Headquarters, Commodore Brannew announces the current Seven Warlords roster, revealing that Buggy has become a Warlord during the timeskip. The anime adds a comedic scene where Buggy makes a speech about becoming a Four Emperor and then Pirate King.
events.significance: A major reveal that shows how Buggy's reputation from Marineford and his connection to Gol D. Roger led to his Warlord position. The anime's added scene of Buggy declaring he'll become an Emperor is prophetic, as it happens eight years later in the story.

quotes.text: No one expected me to become a Warlord! Next, I'll become one of the Four Emperors, and then the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy's anime-original speech to viewers (prophetic of his future Emperor status)

events.title: Admiral Fujitora Dispatched
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sakazuki dispatches Admiral Fujitora to deal with the situation involving Doflamingo, Luffy, and Law. This is Fujitora's first mention in the series, though he doesn't physically appear yet.
events.significance: Introduces one of the new Admirals recruited during the timeskip. Fujitora's dispatch sets up his major role in the Dressrosa Arc and establishes the Marines' interest in the situation.

events.title: Donquixote Pirates Executive Meeting
events.description: At Dressrosa, a meeting with the top members of the Donquixote Pirates is shown. Diamante, Trebol, Pica, and Baby 5 make their debut appearances in the anime. Doflamingo praises Diamante for his supervision of the Colosseum.
events.significance: Introduces the top executives of the Donquixote Pirates who will serve as major antagonists throughout the Dressrosa Arc. Establishes the crew's hierarchy and organization.

events.title: Mera Mera no Mi Revealed in Doflamingo's Possession
events.description: Doflamingo reveals that he possesses the Mera Mera no Mi, the Flame-Flame Fruit that once belonged to Portgas D. Ace. He presents it in a decorative box to his executives, stating there's no way Luffy would let anyone have his brother's power. Doflamingo plans to use it as bait in the Corrida Colosseum tournament.
events.significance: This is one of the most shocking reveals of the arc. The reappearance of Ace's Devil Fruit creates an emotional hook for Luffy and sets up the Corrida Colosseum tournament subplot. It demonstrates how Devil Fruits reincarnate after a user's death and shows Doflamingo's cruel psychological manipulation.

quotes.text: There's no way Luffy would let anyone have his brother's power.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo explaining his plan to use the Mera Mera no Mi as bait

events.title: Corrida Colosseum Tournament Announced
events.description: Doflamingo reveals his plan to hold a tournament at the Corrida Colosseum with the Mera Mera no Mi as the prize. Diamante will oversee the tournament, and the fruit will be used to lure strong fighters and distract the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Sets up the entire Corrida Colosseum subplot that runs throughout much of the Dressrosa Arc. This tournament becomes a major parallel storyline where important characters like Sabo and Rebecca are introduced.

quotes.text: I have something you want very badly, Straw Hat.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Taunting Luffy during their Den Den Mushi conversation

quotes.text: No one expected me to become a Warlord! Next, I'll become one of the Four Emperors, and then the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Anime-original scene where Buggy declares his ambitions to viewers

quotes.text: There's no way Luffy would let anyone have his brother's power.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Explaining why the Mera Mera no Mi will be perfect bait for Luffy

quotes.text: Luffy and Law teaming up... They must be going after one of the Four Emperors too.
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid
quotes.context: Analyzing the news about Luffy and Law's alliance

themes.description: The episode heavily focuses on Ace's legacy through the Mera Mera no Mi. Doflamingo's possession of Ace's Devil Fruit represents how the memories of the fallen can be weaponized, and how their power continues to influence the world after their death.
themes.symbolism: The Mera Mera no Mi symbolizes Ace's enduring presence in Luffy's journey and the emotional weight of his loss.

themes.description: The episode showcases multiple layers of strategy and manipulation. Doflamingo's fake resignation, his plan to use the Mera Mera no Mi as bait, and Law's counter-strategy to destroy the SMILE Factory all demonstrate the complex chess game of the New World.
themes.symbolism: The Den Den Mushi conversations represent the long-distance power plays and psychological warfare between major players.

themes.description: The reshuffling of the Seven Warlords, the introduction of Admiral Fujitora, and the various reactions from pirates across the New World all emphasize the changing power dynamics in the post-timeskip era.
themes.symbolism: Buggy's improbable rise to Warlord status symbolizes how reputation and luck can sometimes trump actual strength in the world of One Piece.

characterSpotlights.development: Doflamingo is established as a master manipulator who uses psychological warfare. His possession of the Mera Mera no Mi and his strategic fake resignation show his cunning nature.
keyActions: Reveals he possesses the Mera Mera no Mi
Taunts Luffy about having something he wants
quotes: I have something you want very badly, Straw Hat.
There's no way Luffy would let anyone have his brother's power.

characterSpotlights.development: Law reveals his tactical mind by explaining the plan to destroy the SMILE Factory. He shows his commitment to taking down Doflamingo and demonstrates why he's a valuable ally to Luffy.
keyActions: Explains the SMILE Factory destruction plan
Participates in the Den Den Mushi call with Doflamingo
Strategizes about using the hostage exchange as a distraction

characterSpotlights.development: Buggy's reveal as a Warlord showcases how his reputation from Marineford has led to an undeserved but significant position. The anime-original scene of him declaring future Emperor status is prophetic.
keyActions: Revealed as one of the Seven Warlords
Makes grand declarations about his future (anime-original)
quotes: No one expected me to become a Warlord! Next, I'll become one of the Four Emperors, and then the Pirate King!

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga, Crocodile's appearance was kept ambiguous with only a shadowy figure shown. The anime confirms it's Crocodile by showing his trademark fur coat and golden hook.

The anime adds a scene where Buggy breaks the fourth wall and makes a speech to viewers about becoming a Warlord, then declares he'll become a Four Emperor and Pirate King before being silenced. This scene doesn't exist in the manga.
In the manga, only Lao G and Giolla are shown yelling at Baby 5 after Trebol jokingly asked her to marry him. The anime also includes Machvise yelling at her.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first use of 'Wake up!' as the opening theme, which celebrates the 15th anniversary of the One Piece anime.
This is the first episode of the Dressrosa Arc, which spans 118 episodes (629-746), making it the second longest arc in the anime.
Buggy's anime-original declaration of becoming a Four Emperor actually came true eight years later (in episode 1056) when Buggy became recognized as an Emperor.
Brook's fart sound in this episode was uniquely recorded from an editor rather than using a reused sound effect.
This episode adapts Chapter 700 (pages 2-19), titled 'His Own Pace'.

sources.title: List of One Piece Episode to Chapter Conversion - ListFist.com

trivia.fact: The simulcast on Funimation and Crunchyroll aired one day before the Japanese broadcast due to time zone differences.
